title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | SB 1.17.20 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 01-03-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवेनमहा नमाओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते बक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासाधी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा राम रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चेवनरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत।
In this session we will be discussing from the 20th verse of the 17th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
अपिकेशु अपिनिष्चयह अत्रानु रूपं राजर्षे विम्रुष स्वमनीषया
The meaning of this verse is, there are also some thinkers who believe that
no one can ascertain the cause of distress by argumentation, nor know it by imagination, nor express it by words.
O sage amongst kings, judge for yourself.
By thinking over all this with your own intelligence.
विम्रुष स्वमनीषया
So, this is the reply given by Dharma, the personality of religion, to Pariksit's question.
So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada explained,
The Vaishnavites, the devotees of the Lord, do believe as above explained,
that nothing can take place without the sanction of the Supreme Lord.
He is the Supreme Director, for he confirms in the Bhagavad Gita, 15.15,
that he, as all-pervading Paramatma, stays in everyone's heart and keeps vigilance over all actions and witnesses all activities.
and select students of every discipline according to his should and

of Wrboys and they are all in the form of ROMA,
the Papa, one can be rowed to eat animals,
mahi-y rechtsf cereal
even if it is simple to lip niveau,
misdeeds unless proved before qualified justice is refuted herein for we accept
the perpetual witness and constant companion of the living being atheists
have got this argument that if you are saying that I am suffering because of
some sinful activities I did in my previous life where is the proof that I
was existing in a previous life and what is the evidence for my having
performed some sinful activity in some previous life this is their argument
but even though I don't remember
or I cannot produce an evidence or any living being of this world cannot
produce evidence in terms of material evidence in terms of one's past life
still Paramatma is there in everybody's heart who has existed eternally in the
past who remains to continues to exist now and who will remain after everything
is finished
so he is the constant companion of every living entity in this material
world he is the perpetual witness of everything that is happening and it is
he only who remembers knows everything we have done and who exactly directs
Kala
and directs material nature to inflict suffering or give enjoyment exactly
according to our karma and according to the time the karma is rectified so
everything is perfectly explained in the Vedanta philosophy
so Srila Prabhupada further says a living being may forget all that he might have done in his past or present
so Srila Prabhupada further says a living being may forget all that he might have done in his past or present
but one must know that in the same tree of the material body the individual soul and the supreme soul as Paramatma are sitting like two birds
this is the verse of the Upanishad
the Upanishad says this body is like a tree and there are two birds sitting within or on this tree
the individual spirit soul the jiva soul and the super soul paramatma
Jīvātma, Paravātma. Both of them are sitting.
So the Upaniṣad says, one of them, the living being, is enjoying the fruits of the tree.
Whatever the result of our actions is given to us as the fruits.
And it is also described in the Upaniṣads that some of the fruits are bitter, some fruits are sweet.
So the bitter fruits are the distress we suffer.
And the sweet fruits are the enjoyment we get as the result of our actions in the past.
Some actions yield enjoyment as sweet fruits.
And some of our previous actions yield us bitter fruit, which is nothing but distress or suffering.
The Supreme Being is there inside to witness the activities.
Therefore the Paramātmā feature, the Supreme Soul, is actually the witness of all activities of the living being.
And only by His direction,
can the living being remember or forget what He might have done in the past.
So He remembers everything and He gives direction to the living being to remember or forget.
He is there for both the all-pervading impersonal Brahman and the localized Paramātmā in everyone's heart.
So what is the meaning of this?
The Supreme Absolute Truth, Krishna,
the Supreme Personality of Godhead,
has got a feature called Brahman feature.
Impersonal, all-pervading Brahman.
Impersonal because Brahman has no personal features.
Brahman is energy.
Brahman is the varieties of energy of the Supreme Lord.
That is Brahman.
And Paramātmā is localized.
It is in the heart of every living entity.
Paramātmā is seated.
So localized expansion of the Supreme Lord.
And that Paramātmā actually is the knower of all past, present and future.
And nothing can be hidden from Him.
The devotees know this truth.
And therefore they discharge their duties sincerely,
without being overly anxious for rewards.
If Paramātmā is always active,
and Paramātmā exactly gives us the result of our own activities of the past,
according to Kāla,
then why should we be anxious about the result of any activity we do?
If we do properly some activity,
Paramātmā will give us the proper result.
We have to do it properly.
But we don't care whether we do actions properly or not.
And then expect that somehow I'll get success or I'll get the result I desire.
No. That's never going to happen.
Besides that,
one cannot estimate the Lord's reactions either by speculation or by scholarship.
See, what exactly we have done in the past, we do not know.
Even if somehow somebody were to find out,
what is the particular reaction for every action,
exactly cannot be determined accurately by any human being or any devata.
Any created being cannot estimate.
Cannot find out.
Why does he put someone into difficulty and not others?
He is a supreme knower of the Vedic knowledge and thus he is a factual Vedantist.
Same time he is a compiler of the Vedanta.
No one is independent of him.
Everyone is engaged in his service in different ways.
This we have to also understand.
What is the meaning of everyone is engaged in his service according to his will?
That is, if I don't serve Krishna,
which is the case in this material world with most people,
then I am forced to serve the dictation of the illusory energy
who is directed by Krishna.
So indirectly I will have to follow Krishna.
Indirectly.
So therefore Prabhupada says everyone is engaged in his service in different ways.
In the conditioned state, that means our present state of existence,
such services are endured by the living being under force of the material nature.
The material nature is forcing us.
We cannot say I won't do anything.
We may say like that and sit down.
But then we will be forced to do something by the influence of material modes.
Just like a lazy person also
is active mentally,
is active mentally or can be active even through speech.
So actions are performed through the mind,
through the words and through the body, external body.
So all three types of actions are there.
So even a lazy person may be physically not working.
But mentally is active.
Vocally is active.
So even the lazy person also is active.
We cannot deny that.
So the devotees,
they are engaged in devotional service in order to please Krishna.
And that is the liberated state of the devotee.
When any activity is done for the sake of pleasing Krishna,
then such activities are all above the gunas, gunatit.
So this
living beings,
either they do devotional service and serve the Supreme Lord for pleasing Him,
they are in the liberated state.
Or somebody doesn't want to do devotional service,
wants to be independent of Krishna,
then they are forced by material nature
to engage in some material activities
according to the dictation of the three gunas,
the illusory energy, the material energy.
So in His actions, the Supreme Lord's actions,
there is no incongruity or inebriety.
Inebriety means there is no defect.
And incongruity means there is nothing illogical or unreasonable or meaningless.
Everything is full of meaning.
All are on the path of the Absolute Truth.
Everyone, without exception.
The conclusion is, therefore,
that the sufferings of the representative of religion
and the representative of the earth,
as present before Maharaj Pariksit,
were planned to prove that
Maharaj Pariksit was the ideal executive head
because he knew well how to give protection to the cows,
the earth,
and the Brahmanas, religious principles,
the two pillars of spiritual advancement.
Maharaj Pariksit as a Rajarshi, he knew perfectly.
Everyone is under the full control of the Lord,
and the Lord Himself is always correct in His action
when He desires something to be done by someone,
irrespective of the consideration of the particular case.
So Maharaj Pariksit was put to test for His greatness
and how He solves this problem of who is the cause
for the suffering of the bull and the cow,
that is Dharma and Mother Earth.
That we will see in the next verse.
So I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
